medical_history.chief_complaint: Patients presenting with either Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS) or Membranoproliferative Glomerulonephritis (MPGN) associated with Factor H deficiencies.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: HUS onset occurred from birth to mid-adulthood, with variable disease progression. Four children undergoing renal transplantation had varying outcomes: three successful and one failure due to recurrence of HUS.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Heterozygous and Homozygous Factor H Deficiencies associated with HUS or MPGN. Some patients presented with hypertension, renal failure, and required plasma exchanges or hemodialysis.
medical_history.family_history: Several patients had family histories suggesting hereditary conditions; some families exhibited high consanguinity and prior instances of HUS.
